speaker: Patient
text: I think I missed a dose of the glipizide last week. My wife usually reminds me, but we were out visiting our daughter.

speaker: Clinician
text: That happens. It's important to try and take it consistently, though. Have you noticed any changes in your blood sugar readings since then?

speaker: Patient
text: Yeah, they were a bit higher than usual. I was worried it might be because of that missed dose.

speaker: Clinician
text: It's possible. Glipizide helps your body produce more insulin, so missing a dose can affect your levels. Do you have a system in place for when you're traveling?

speaker: Patient
text: We usually set alarms on our phones, but I guess we just got caught up with family stuff.

speaker: Clinician
text: Understandable. Maybe a pill organizer could help, especially for trips. It might make it easier to keep track.
